    streamFind for mass spectrometry with R

MassSpecData R6 class and methods

Source: R/class_R6_MassSpecData.R
MassSpecData.Rd

The MassSpecData R6 class is a framework with methods for parsing, processing, visualizing and storing MS data.

References

Method new()

Checks the analyses argument as a character/integer vector to match analyses names or indices from the MassSpecData object. Returns a valid character vector with analysis names or NULL for non-matching.

Gets an entry from the analyses private field.

Creates an R6 MassSpecData class object. When headers are not given (i.e., NULL), a default Headers S3 class object is generated with name as NA_character, path as get_wd() and date as Sys.time(). See ?Headers for more information.

Usage

MassSpecData$new(
  files = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  headers = NULL,
  settings = NULL,
  analyses = NULL,
  groups = NULL,
  alignment = NULL
)

Arguments

files

A character vector with full file path/s of mzML or mzXML file/s or a data.frame with the columns file, replicate and blank with the full file path of mzML or mzXML file/s (character), the replicate group name (character) and the associated blank replicate group name (character). Note the file paths must have the extension .mzML or .mzXML.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

headers

A named list with headers or a Headers S3 class object. Each list element must have length one. There is no type restrictions except for name (must be type character), path (must be type character) and date (must be class POSIXct or class POSIXt). See more information in ?Headers.

settings

A named list of ProcessingSettings S3 class objects or a single ProcessingSettings S3 class object. The list names should match the call name of each ProcessingSettings object. Alternatively, a named list with call name, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and added as ProcessingSettings S3 class object.

analyses

A MassSpecAnalysis S3 class object or a list with MassSpecAnalysis S3 class objects as elements (see ?MassSpecAnalysis for more information).

groups

A data.table with feature groups from correspondence across MS analyses as obtained by the method get_groups(). Note that correspondence of features across MS analyses is performed with the method group_features().

alignment

A named list with a data.table for each analysis with the results from alignment of features or correspondence of features across analyses. The names of the list must match the names of the analyses.

Returns

A new MassSpecData class object.

Method print()

Prints a summary of the MassSpecData object in the console.

Usage

MassSpecData$print()

Returns

Console text.

Method get_headers()

Gets the headers.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_headers(value = NULL)

Arguments

value

A character vector with the name/s of the header elements. When NULL, the entire headers list is returned.

Returns

The headers list or the header elements as defined by value.

Method get_analyses()

Gets analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_analyses(analyses = NULL)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

Returns

The list of analyses or the analyses as defined by analyses argument.

Method get_number_analyses()

Gets the number of analyses present.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_number_analyses()

Returns

An integer value.

Method get_overview()

Gets the overview data.frame with all the analysis types, names, replicates, associated blank replicates, polarities and full file paths.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_overview()

Returns

A data.frame with columns type, analysis, replicate, blank polarity and file.

Method get_tic()

Gets the total ion chromatogram (TIC) from the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_tic(analyses = NULL, levels = 1)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

Returns

A data.table with the TIC chromatogram.

Method get_bpc()

MassSpecData$get_bpc(analyses = NULL, levels = 1)

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

Returns

A character vector.

Method get_spectra()

Gets spectra from the MS analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_spectra(
  analyses = NULL,
  levels = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  allTraces = TRUE,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  minIntensityMS1 = 0,
  minIntensityMS2 = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

allTraces

Logical, when TRUE all level 2 data is returned. When FALSE and level has 2, only the MS2 traces of MS1 targets are returned, using the isolationWindow to calculate the mass window.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

minIntensityMS1

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 1 data (i.e., MS1 data).

minIntensityMS2

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 2 data (i.e., MS2 data).

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table with spectra for each analyses and targets, when defined.

Method get_chromatograms()

Gets chromatograms from the MS analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_chromatograms(
  analyses = NULL,
  index = NA_integer_,
  minIntensity = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

index

Integer value with the index.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table with chromatogram/s.

Method get_eic()

Gets extract ion chromatograms (EIC) from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_eic(
  analyses = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_ms1()

Gets MS1 data from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_ms1(
  analyses = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  mzClust = 0.003,
  verbose = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 1000,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.frame.

Method get_ms2()

Gets MS2 data from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_ms2(
  analyses = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  mzClust = 0.005,
  verbose = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.frame.

Method get_settings()

Gets processing settings.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_settings(call = NULL)

Arguments

call

A string or a vector of strings with the name/s of the processing method/s.

Returns

A list with ProcessingSettings S3 class object/s.

Method get_features()

Gets features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  filtered = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

Returns

A data.frame.

Method get_features_eic()

Gets EIC of features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features_eic(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtExpand = 120,
  mzExpand = 0.005,
  filtered = FALSE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtExpand

Numeric value with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the mass range.

mzExpand

Numeric value with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_features_ms1()

Gets an averaged MS1 spectrum for features in analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features_ms1(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtWindow = c(-2, 2),
  mzWindow = c(-5, 100),
  mzClust = 0.003,
  minIntensity = 1000,
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedMS1 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the retention time range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) values (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_features_ms2()

Gets an averaged MS2 spectrum for features in analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features_ms2(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  mzClust = 0.003,
  minIntensity = 0,
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedMS2 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedMS2

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded MS2 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_groups()

Gets feature groups from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_groups(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  filtered = FALSE,
  onlyIntensities = FALSE,
  average = FALSE
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

onlyIntensities

Logical. When TRUE, only feature intensity values are returned. Feature metadata for each group is excluded.

average

Logical. When TRUE, feature intensities from each group are averaged and returned for each analysis replicate group.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_groups_ms1()

Gets an averaged MS1 spectrum for feature groups in analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_groups_ms1(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtWindow = c(-2, 2),
  mzWindow = c(-5, 90),
  mzClustFeatures = 0.003,
  minIntensityFeatures = 1000,
  loadedFeaturesMS1 = TRUE,
  mzClustGroups = 0.003,
  minIntensityGroups = 1000,
  groupBy = "groups",
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedGroupsMS1 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the retention time range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) values (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzClustFeatures

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for features. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensityFeatures

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for features.

loadedFeaturesMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded features MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

mzClustGroups

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for feature groups. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensityGroups

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for feature groups.

groupBy

String with the way of grouping. Possible values are groups and replicates to groups by feature groups or feature groups and replicates, respectively.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedGroupsMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded feature groups MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. loadedFeaturesMS2

mzClustGroups

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for feature groups. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensityGroups

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for feature groups.

groupBy

String with the way of grouping. Possible values are groups and replicates to groups by feature groups or feature groups and replicates, respectively.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedGroupsMS2

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded feature groups MS2 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method add_headers()

Adds headers. If an argument or element "name" is given, it must be type character. If an argument or element path is given, it must be type character and exist. If an argument or element date is given, it must be class POSIXct or POSIXt. If given date is character, conversion to class POSIXct or POSIXt is attempted. See ?Headers for more information.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_headers(...)

Arguments

...

Arguments to be added as headers. Note that all given arguments must be of length one. There is no type limitations. The name of the argument becomes the name of the header entry. Alternatively, a single list argument with the headers (all length one) can be given.

Returns

Invisible.

Method add_settings()

Adds processing settings.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_settings(settings = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A named list of ProcessingSettings S3 class objects or a single ProcessingSettings S3 class object. The list names should match the call name of each ProcessingSettings object. Alternatively, a named list with call name, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and added as ProcessingSettings S3 class object.

Returns

Invisible.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_analyses(analyses = NULL)

Arguments

analyses

A MassSpecAnalysis S3 class object or a list with MassSpecAnalysis S3 class objects as elements (see ?MassSpecAnalysis for more information).

Returns

Invisible.

Method add_features()

Adds features to analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_features(features = NULL, replace = TRUE)

Arguments

features

A data.table with features from MS analyses as obtained by the method get_features(). Note that features are obtained with the method find_features().

replace

Logical. When TRUE, existing features are replaced by the new features.

Returns

Invisible.

Method add_groups()

Adds feature groups. Note that existing features groups are replaced!

Usage

MassSpecData$add_groups(groups = NULL)

Arguments

groups

A data.table with feature groups from correspondence across MS analyses as obtained by the method get_groups(). Note that correspondence of features across MS analyses is performed with the method group_features().

Returns

Invisible.

Invisible.

Method load_features_ms1()

Loads and average MS1 spectra from features in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$load_features_ms1(settings = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Returns

Invisible.

Method load_features_ms2()

Loads and average MS2 spectra from features in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$load_features_ms2(settings = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Returns

Invisible.

Method load_groups_ms1()

Loads and average MS1 spectra from feature groups. If MS1 spectra from features are already loaded, the feature MS1 spectra are used for averaging into the respective feature group. If features MS1 spectra are not present, settings for loading and averaging features MS1 spectra (i.e., settings with call name "load_features_ms1") must be given in the settingsFeatures argument or added beforehand with the add_settings method.

Usage

MassSpecData$load_groups_ms1(settings = NULL, settingsFeatures = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

settingsFeatures

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method for features. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the features processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Returns

Invisible.

Method load_groups_ms2()

Loads and average MS2 spectra from feature groups. If MS2 spectra from features are already loaded, the feature MS2 spectra are used for averaging into the respective feature group. If features MS2 spectra are not present, settings for loading and averaging features MS2 spectra (i.e., settings with call name "load_features_ms2") must be given in the settingsFeatures argument or added beforehand with the add_settings method.

Usage

MassSpecData$load_groups_ms2(settings = NULL, settingsFeatures = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

settingsFeatures

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method for features. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the features processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Returns

Invisible.

Removes settings.

Usage

Returns

Invisible.

Removes alignment results.

Usage

MassSpecData$remove_alignment()

Returns

Invisible.

Method subset_analyses()

Subsets a MassSpecData object on analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$subset_analyses(analyses = NULL)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

Returns

A new cloned MassSpecData object with only the analyses as defined by the analyses argument.

Method subset_features()

Subsets a MassSpecData object on features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$subset_features(features = NULL)

Arguments

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

Returns

A new cloned MassSpecData object with only the features as defined by the features argument.

Method subset_groups()

Subsets a MassSpecData object on groups from correspondence of features across analyses. Note that when sub-setting groups, features that lose correspondence are not removed but filtered with "grouping" added as filter category/tag. Filtered features can be removed with the method remove_features(filtered = TRUE).

Usage

MassSpecData$subset_groups(groups = NULL)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

Returns

A new cloned MassSpecData object with only the groups as defined by the groups argument.

Logical value.

Method plot_spectra()

Plots spectra for given MS analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_spectra(
  analyses = NULL,
  levels = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  allTraces = TRUE,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  minIntensityMS1 = 0,
  minIntensityMS2 = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  colorBy = "analyses"
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

allTraces

Logical, when TRUE all level 2 data is returned. When FALSE and level has 2, only the MS2 traces of MS1 targets are returned, using the isolationWindow to calculate the mass window.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

minIntensityMS1

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 1 data (i.e., MS1 data).

minIntensityMS2

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 2 data (i.e., MS2 data).

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses (the default), levels, targets or replicates.

Returns

A 3D interactive plot.

Method plot_xic()

Plots extract ion chromatograms (EIC) and m/z vs retention time from the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_xic(
  analyses = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  plotTargetMark = TRUE,
  targetsMark = NULL,
  ppmMark = 5,
  secMark = 10,
  numberRows = 1
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

plotTargetMark

Logical, set to TRUE to plot a target mark.

targetsMark

A data.frame with columns mz and rt, defining the m/z and retention time values of each target. Note that the number of rows should match with the number of targets.

ppmMark

A numeric vector of length one to define the mass deviation, in ppm, of the target mark. The default is 5 ppm.

secMark

A numeric vector of length one to define the time deviation, in seconds, of the target mark. The default is 10 ppm.

numberRows

An integer vector of length one to define the number of rows to grid the plots. Note that each target is always plotted in one row for all selected analyses.

Returns

An interactive plot.

Method plot_eic()

Plots extract ion chromatograms (EIC) from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_eic(
  analyses = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_ms2()

Plots MS2 spectra from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_ms2(
  analyses = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  id = NULL,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  mzClust = 0.005,
  verbose = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_features()

Plots features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_features(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtExpand = 120,
  mzExpand = 0.005,
  filtered = FALSE,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtExpand

Numeric value with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the mass range.

mzExpand

Numeric value with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

plot.

Method map_features()

Plots a map of the retention time vs m/z of features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$map_features(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  filtered = FALSE,
  xlim = 30,
  ylim = 0.05,
  showLegend = TRUE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

xlim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the x limits (in seconds) of the plot.

ylim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the m/z limits of the plot.

showLegend

Logical. Set to TRUE to show legend.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_features_ms1()

Plots MS1 spectra from features in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_features_ms1(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtWindow = c(-2, 2),
  mzWindow = c(-5, 100),
  mzClust = 0.003,
  minIntensity = 1000,
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedMS1 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the retention time range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) values (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedMS2

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded MS2 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_alignment()

Plots the results from the retention time alignment across analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_alignment()

Returns

A plot with the retention time alignment differences for each sample.

Method plot_groups()

Plots feature groups EIC.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_groups(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtExpand = 120,
  mzExpand = 0.005,
  filtered = FALSE,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtExpand

Numeric value with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the mass range.

mzExpand

Numeric value with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_groups_ms1()

Plots MS1 spectra from feature groups in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_groups_ms1(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtWindow = c(-2, 2),
  mzWindow = c(-5, 90),
  mzClustFeatures = 0.005,
  minIntensityFeatures = 1000,
  loadedFeaturesMS1 = TRUE,
  mzClustGroups = 0.005,
  minIntensityGroups = 1000,
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedGroupsMS1 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the retention time range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) values (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzClustFeatures

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for features. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensityFeatures

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for features.

loadedFeaturesMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded features MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

mzClustGroups

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for feature groups. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

minIntensityGroups

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for feature groups.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedGroupsMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded feature groups MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Plots MS1 spectra from feature groups in the analyses.

Usage

filtered

loadedGroupsMS2

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded feature groups MS2 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

legendNames

Method plot_groups_overview()

Method to give an overview of the EIC, alignment and intensity variance from features within target feature groups.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_groups_overview(
  analyses = NULL,
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  rtExpand = 120,
  mzExpand = 0.005,
  filtered = FALSE,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  heights = c(0.35, 0.5, 0.15)
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt. Then, the deviations given in the ppm and sec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z and retention time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin and rtmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm and sec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

rtExpand

Numeric value with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the mass range.

mzExpand

Numeric value with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

heights

A numeric vector of length 3 to control the height of the first, second and third plot, respectively.

Returns

A plot.

Method find_features()

Finds features (i.e., chromatographic peaks) from MS data in analyses. The function uses the patRoon package for peak finding, enabling the use of several algorithms (see details). Note that the settings call name must be "find_features".

Usage

MassSpecData$find_features(settings = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Details

See the findFeatures function from the patRoon package or the reference guide for more information. The following algorithms are available via patRoon: "xcms3", "xcms", "openms", "envipick", "sirius", "kpic2", "safd". The algorithm in the settings should be one of the described. The parameters are given as a list and should match with algorithm requirements. Certain algorithms also require defined MS file formats and data in profile mode.

Returns

Invisible.

Method group_features()

Groups and aligns features across analyses. The function uses the patRoon package for grouping features, enabling the use of several algorithms (see details). Note that the settings call name must be "group_features".

Usage

MassSpecData$group_features(settings = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Details

See the groupFeatures function from the patRoon package or the reference guide for more information. The following algorithms are possible: "xcms3", "xcms", "openms" or "kpic2". The algorithm slot in the settings should be one of the described. The parameters are given as a list and should match with algorithm requirements.

Returns

Invisible.

Method as_features_patRoon()

Creates an object with S4 class features from the package patRoon with the features in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$as_features_patRoon()

Returns

An object with S4 class features.

MassSpecData$check_correspondence()

TRUE or FALSE.

Method save_headers()

Saves the headers list.

Usage

MassSpecData$save_headers(format = "json", name = "headers", path = getwd())

Arguments

format

A string. Possible values are json and rds for saving as JSON or RDS formats, respectively.

name

String with the name of the file to be saved.

path

String with the directory of the file to be saved.

Returns

Saves the headers list as the defined format in path and returns invisible.

Method save_settings()

Saves settings.

Usage

MassSpecData$save_settings(
  call = NULL,
  format = "json",
  name = "settings",
  path = getwd()
)

Arguments

call

A string or a vector of strings with the name/s of the processing method/s to be saved. When call is NULL all settings are saved.

format

A string. Possible values are json and rds for saving as JSON or RDS formats, respectively.

name

String with the name of the file to be saved.

path

String with the directory of the file to be saved.

Returns

Saves the settings list as the defined format in path and returns invisible.

Arguments

A string. Possible values are json and rds for saving as JSON or RDS formats, respectively.

name

String with the name of the file to be saved.

path

String with the directory of the file to be saved.

Returns

Saves the private fields of the msdata as the defined format in the path and returns invisible.
